p:
The aims of this paper are thus to (i) contrast benefits and costs of invasive Prosopis, (ii) update knowledge on Prosopis occurrence and introductions globally and highlight the potential range expansion of Prosopis, (iii) elucidate ecological, economic and social factors that shape attempts at managing Prosopis, (iv) compare and contrast the effectiveness of different management approaches in different regions, and (v) identify priorities for research and policy development. We review the literature and collate data from many sources. Details on the approach for the literature review, approaches used for statistical analyses and climate matching are provided in
Supporting Information .
